授業目的:
1. To help students better understand intercultural workplaces
2. To help students communicate effectively in an English-speaking working environment
3. To develop students’ language skills (listening, speaking, reading, and writing) with a focus on business contexts
4. To develop students’ cross-cultural awareness
5. To help students improve their TOEIC test-taking skills
到達目標:
1. Students will develop their cultural awareness.
2. Students will acquire the English communication skills needed in business settings.
3. Students will familiarize themselves with English as it is used in business situations.
4. Students will become better TOEIC test-takers.
授業方法:
1. This course will be conducted in English only and English will be the means of communication between the students and the instructor. (Students will also be expected to communicate with one another in English.)
2. Students are encouraged to actively participate in class discussions, both independently and collaboratively, in order to enhance their competence and confidence in English and also to create a better learning environment for all.

評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
Active participation is extremely important and counts as a significant part of students’ evaluation marks.
2. Attendance is crucial to students’ success in this course. You should treat this course as if it is a real world work assignment and communicate accordingly, in a courteous manner, if you are going to be late or absent. Specific guidelines regarding attendance are as follows:
2a) Only students who are present at the time the class begins will receive full attendance marks. Late arrivals due to technical issues are excused.
2b) Absences and late arrivals to class will be taken into account when giving students a participation grade. Excused absences will not be taken into account.
2c) Each 10 minutes late will be minus 0.1 out of 1.0 (i.e. 20 minutes late = 0.8 / 40 minutes = 0.6)
2d) Each time students are late 30 minutes or more, they will be marked late. However, they are still encouraged to attend. Absences due to technical issues will be excused, but students should inform the instructor via email when they are experiencing such problems.
2e) As a general rule, no more than three absences will be permitted in this course.
評価.備考Note0: In principle, the use of smartphones, tablets, and other electronic devices in the classroom is forbidden. Students must store them in their bags throughout the entire duration of each class. In the case of a project in which internet connection is necessary, the instructor may instruct students to use their electronic devices, but unless such a situation is specifically and clearly suggested by the instructor, their use will be strictly prohibited.
